title: 112_hr4045
content: The Secretary of Defense has the discretion to decide if changes to the Program Guidance for awarding Post-Deployment/Mobilization Respite Absence days to reserve component members will apply to those whose mobilization started before October 1, 2011, and continued after that date. The Secretary of Defense may provide benefits to members or former members of the Armed Forces related to Post-Deployment/Mobilization Respite Absence days. This includes payment or administrative absence for qualifying individuals. The Secretary of Defense may provide benefits to members of the Armed Forces, including one day of administrative absence or payment up to $200 for each qualifying day. This applies to members serving in the Selected Reserve, Inactive National Guard, or Individual Ready Reserve. The Secretary of Defense may provide benefits to members of the Armed Forces, including one day of administrative absence or payment up to $200 for each qualifying day. Former members discharged under dishonorable conditions are not eligible for benefits. Payments can be made in a lump sum or installments. These benefits are in addition to any other pay, absence, or leave provided by law. The "Post-Deployment/Mobilization Respite Absence program" provides days of administrative absence not chargeable against available leave. The Secretary of Defense may provide days of administrative absence not chargeable against available leave to certain deployed or mobilized members of the Armed Forces to assist in their reintegration into civilian life. The authority for this program begins upon enactment of the Act and expires on October 1, 2014. The expiration date specified in paragraph (2) does not affect the use of administrative absence or payment selected by a member of the Armed Forces. Cash payments under subsection (b) require available funds from an appropriations Act. The Secretary of Defense will transfer $4,000,000 to the Treasury from unobligated balances of the Pentagon Reservation Maintenance Revolving Fund.
